Event.name: Processing_materials
Event.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> alters some <fen>Material</fen> in some useful way by means of some chemical or physical <fen>Alterant</fen>. Typically, this involves placing a reagent in contact with the <fen>Material</fen>, or applying heat, pressure, etc. Often a specific <fen>Agent</fen> and/or <fen>Result</fen> is mentioned. The <fen>Alterant</fen> is often incorporated in the target, as in <ment>tin.v, galvanize</ment>. (The Preserving frame is a special case of Processing_materials, in which the <fen>Material</fen> is immersed in the <fen>Alterant</fen> for the Purpose of preventing decay.) Processing_materials is distinguished from Filling in that the <fen>Material</fen> in Processing_materials is fundamentally altered (often chemically), rather than simply being covered with a different substance. <ex><fex name="Agent">Native Americans</fex> <t>dyed</t> <fex name="Material">textiles</fex> <fex name="Alterant">with dyes made from cedar strips</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Material">Watering cans</fex> are often <t><fex name="Alterant">galvanized</fex></t> <fex name="Purpose">to prevent rust</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is a person who applies the Process to the Material.</def-root>

Arg.name: Material
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Material</fen> is altered by the <fen>Agent</fen> in some useful way. <ex>Stu <t>treated</t> <fex name="Mat">the lumber</fex> with magical waterproofing fairydust.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which the <fen>Agent</fen> processes the <fen>Material</fen>. <ex>He <t>treated</t> the exterior of the house with waterproofing <fex name="Pur">to protect his valuable peanut butter collection.</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>The result of the processing action, whether intended or not.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time during which the application of the <fen>Alterant</fen> is applied to the <fen>Material</fen></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location in which the <fen>Material</fen>s are processed, often a purpose-built facility such as a tannery or water treatment plant.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The point in time or period during which the treatment of the <fen>Material</fen> takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Subregion
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The part of the <fen>Material</fen> which is affected by the process.
<ex>You have to <t>galvanize</t> the pipes <fex name="Subregion">only in the interior</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> is responding to in processing the <fen>Material</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Dimension
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The dimension or aspect of the <fen>Material</fen> that is processed.
<ex>This supernatant was used for neasurement of <fex name="dim">isotopic</fex> <t>enrichment</t> of free leucine.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A holistic description encompassing all the details of an act of processing, often indicated by giving a characteristic of the <fen>Agent</fen> that affects the action.
<ex>Botulinum can not be <t>weaponized</t> <fex name="Manner">the same way</fex> .</ex> </def-root>

lexUnit.name: stain.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: apply a colorant to a solid for the purpose of coloring it (darker than it originally was).

lexUnit.name: dye.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: apply a liquid to a solid (especially fabric) in order to color it (darker than it originally was)

lexUnit.name: etch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: apply a chemical (usually an acid) to a surface to make it rougher.

lexUnit.name: treat.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: To apply a chemical to or otherwise process (e.g. with heat or pressure) a material for a particular purpose.

lexUnit.name: galvanize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: coat (iron or steel) with a protective layer of zinc.

lexUnit.name: enrich.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: increase the proportion of a particular isotope in (an element), especially that of the fissile isotope U-235 in uranium.

lexUnit.name: enrichment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the process of increasing the proportion of a particular isotope in (an element), especially that of the fissile isotope U-235 in uranium.

lexUnit.name: process.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: perform a series of operations to change or preserve.

lexUnit.name: reprocess.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: process (something, especially spent nuclear fuel) again or differently, in order to reuse it.

lexUnit.name: reprocessing.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of taking an industrial product (often spent nuclear fuel rods) and making it useful again or in a different way.

lexUnit.name: weaponize.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: process (a pathogen or chemical) so as to make more deadly and/or virulent

lexUnit.name: weaponization.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: processing (of pathogens or chemicals) so as to make more virulent and/or deadly

lexUnit.name: develop.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: applying chemicals to photographic film in order to bring out images

lexUnit.name: development.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the processing of photographic film in order to bring out images
